definition: similar (model)/merchandise similar to that used by a celebrity etc
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
(used in given names)/variant of 同[tong2]
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: Complete this on-trend look with the matching ring.
sentences.chinese: 和同款戒指搭配，打造本季的最时尚造型。

sentences.english: Some are designing multiple versions of a garment to fit different body shapes.
sentences.chinese: 有些设计同款服装的多种尺码以便适合不同体型。

sentences.english: Combine this stunning piece with the matching earrings or ring for an on-trend look.
sentences.chinese: 和同款耳环或戒指搭配，时尚优雅。

sentences.english: Complete this on-trend look with the matching pendant or clip earrings.
sentences.chinese: 和同款链坠或夹式耳环搭配，打造本季的最时尚造型。

sentences.english: The necklaces within the Highlight family can be worn together for an on-trend layered and statement necklace silhouette.
sentences.chinese: 可以和同款首饰一起佩戴，凸显你的时尚气质。

sentences.english: This stunning creation has a nostalgic feel. Combine it with the matching earrings for an on-trend look.
sentences.chinese: 和同款耳环搭配，打造复古怀旧的浪漫风格。

sentences.english: Add the matching ring for a trendy, feminine look.
sentences.chinese: 您亦可搭配同款戒指，打造妩媚动人的时尚风格。

sentences.english: Complimentary matching crystal earrings and rhodium plated chain.
sentences.chinese: 附奉同款水晶耳环和镀铑项链。

definition: to pair up/to match/to arrange in pairs/to add sth into a group
déjà vu
(coll.) to look alike/to be a spitting image of
(neologism c. 2009) don't worry, it's all taken care of
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)
matching outfit for couples
pink/white/erotic/beautiful woman/powdered (with make-up)
pattern/style/design/CL:種|种[zhong3]
elegant/elegance/good taste
to model/to shape/appearance/style/design/form/pose
bag or purse etc/small bump or pimple/hillock
new style/latest fashion/new model
to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate
to appear on camera/to play a role in a film
outfit or suit (of clothes)/set of coordinated items/kit
(coll.) to strike a pose

to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
